definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: What about the fortifications at Verdun and Metz?
sentences.chinese: 那凡爾登與梅斯的防禦工事呢？

sentences.english: What did Channy think of the defence work?
sentences.chinese: 切尼怎樣看待防禦工事？

sentences.english: The beach defences were softened up before the landing craft was in.
sentences.chinese: 在登陸艇駛入以前，海灘防禦工事已遭削弱。

sentences.english: Israel says Hamas, which will be used to build fortifications.
sentences.chinese: 以色列稱，它們將被哈馬斯用來修築防禦工事。

sentences.english: That night (27 -28 June) defensive works were thrown up in selected places near Berestko.
sentences.chinese: 當夜，選定在別列斯科奇附近地方建立防禦工事。

sentences.english: In order to destroy the AA emplacements , you'll need to first deal with the anti-tank fortifications.
sentences.chinese: 爲了破壞機管局進駐，你需要先與反坦克防禦工事。

sentences.english: The city's defenses were too strong.
sentences.chinese: 維克斯堡城的防禦工事實在是太堅固了。

sentences.english: We outflanked the enemy on the left.
sentences.chinese: 防禦工事的左側或右側。

sentences.english: These fortifications were all built during the last war.
sentences.chinese: 這些防禦工事都是上次戰爭時修的。

sentences.english: They refused to render up their fortifications.
sentences.chinese: 他們拒絕撤出防禦工事。

sentences.english: Our troops battered down the enemy defensive works.
sentences.chinese: 我部隊以炮火摧毀了敵人防禦工事。

sentences.english: Our defences were not easily breached.
sentences.chinese: 我們的防禦工事不易被突破。

sentences.english: The beach defenses were softened up before the landing craft went in.
sentences.chinese: 在登陸艇駛入以前，海灘防禦工事已遭到削弱。

sentences.english: He then invested in infrastructure and built massive fortifications.
sentences.chinese: 隨後，他把精力投入到基礎設施和防禦工事的建造上。

sentences.english: Rydal maintained exclusive authority over the defence and foreign relations of the Islands.
sentences.chinese: 賴德爾保留島嶼防禦工事和外交關係的唯一授權。

sentences.english: We burst through the enemy defences.
sentences.chinese: 我們衝破了敵人的防禦工事。

definition: flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
